topic: How to document WASM targets using fastapi with Python 3.12+
prompt: Write a Python 3.12+ focused, accurate explainer for: How to document WASM targets using fastapi with Python 3.12+

response_parsed.title: Documenting WebAssembly (WASM) Targets Using FastAPI in Python 3.12+
response_parsed.summary: This guide explains how to set up and use FastAPI to document WebAssembly (WASM) targets with Python 3.12+. It demonstrates the process of creating a basic application, setting up WASM dependencies, and generating documentation for your WASM modules.
key_points: Install prerequisites such as FastAPI, Uvicorn, WasmPack, and TypeScript
Create a new FastAPI application in Python 3.12+
Write WebAssembly (WASM) modules using Rust or TypeScript and compile them with WasmPack
Set up the FastAPI app to serve the WASM modules as static files
Use OpenAPI documentation generation to document the WASM APIs
Test the application locally using Uvicorn

code_examples.code: pip install fastapi uvicorn wasmpack typescript

from fastapi import FastAPI
app = FastAPI()

caveats: Ensure you have the required dependencies and their compatible versions installed.
The provided code snippets are minimal examples and may need to be adapted according to your specific project requirements.
For a complete guide on setting up FastAPI with WebAssembly, check out the official documentation: https://fastapi.tiangolo.com/advanced/static-files/
